channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @bernstein_judah The goal of the Republican project is for taxpayers to fund unaccountable schools run by radical clerics. Satmar education is the desired end game.
item.source:markdown: @bernstein_judah The goal of the Republican project is for taxpayers to fund unaccountable schools run by radical clerics. Satmar education is the desired end game.

item.description: @HeerJeet I can’t believe a politician would give an answer other than Jesus or MLK to that question.
item.source:markdown: @HeerJeet I can’t believe a politician would give an answer other than Jesus or MLK to that question.

item.description:
@AkivaMCohen I also think that any strategic thoughts we Twitter randos might have regarding the Republican Party or Putin or the like were available to the professionals making the relevant decisions.

@AkivaMCohen Either these thoughts were raised and dismissed, or the decision making process is so broken that nothing we say on here — or even a NYTimes Op Ed — will penetrate.
item.source:markdown:
@AkivaMCohen I also think that any strategic thoughts we Twitter randos might have regarding the Republican Party or Putin or the like were available to the professionals making the relevant decisions.
@AkivaMCohen Either these thoughts were raised and dismissed, or the decision making process is so broken that nothing we say on here — or even a NYTimes Op Ed — will penetrate.

item.description: @swordsjew I’d love to see follow up from this person after they take your advice, or don’t.
item.source:markdown: @swordsjew I’d love to see follow up from this person after they take your advice, or don’t.

item.description: @piateski @rmcoplon @JewWhoHasItAll Perhaps they’re French. The French are very into skipping letters. Maybe they want to save their lip and tongue energy for kissing?
item.source:markdown: @piateski @rmcoplon @JewWhoHasItAll Perhaps they’re French. The French are very into skipping letters. Maybe they want to save their lip and tongue energy for kissing?

item.description: @YeahThatsKosher I feel better about the prosthetic toes after @dzkalman noted that this is just an attempt to market an already existing product.
item.source:markdown: @YeahThatsKosher I feel better about the prosthetic toes after @dzkalman noted that this is just an attempt to market an already existing product.

item.description:
@radleybalko I had the seldom used Instagram account for my publishing company deleted, and by the time I noticed 30 days had passed and Meta claimed to have deleted the reason why.

@radleybalko It’s as if corporations want to remind America why the US government got into the regulation business in the first place.
item.source:markdown:
@radleybalko I had the seldom used Instagram account for my publishing company deleted, and by the time I noticed 30 days had passed and Meta claimed to have deleted the reason why.
@radleybalko It’s as if corporations want to remind America why the US government got into the regulation business in the first place.

item.description: @DBashIdeas Pocket-sized Kahati was a great moment in Jewish publishing history.
item.source:markdown: @DBashIdeas Pocket-sized Kahati was a great moment in Jewish publishing history.

item.description: @onthemainline I really need to reread the Dessler I read as a teen.
item.source:markdown: @onthemainline I really need to reread the Dessler I read as a teen.

item.description: @lavietidhar Well, not all of us can read it in one sitting.
item.source:markdown: @lavietidhar Well, not all of us can read it in one sitting.

item.description: @jewishstudent1 @DainyBernstein He’s not wrong. The Evangelicals will help the schools fight regulation at the Supreme Court, since they admire the theocracy achieved by Satmar.
item.source:markdown: @jewishstudent1 @DainyBernstein He’s not wrong. The Evangelicals will help the schools fight regulation at the Supreme Court, since they admire the theocracy achieved by Satmar.

item.description: @kampeas Unless the chickens the story raises come home to roost. Then it’s a coop again.
item.source:markdown: @kampeas Unless the chickens the story raises come home to roost. Then it’s a coop again.

item.description: Remember: If Hasidic leaders were devoted to the truth, they wouldn’t censor information and do everything in their power to keep information from their followers. https://t.co/N9duikkt0N
item.source:markdown: Remember: If Hasidic leaders were devoted to the truth, they wouldn’t censor information and do everything in their power to keep information from their followers. https://t.co/N9duikkt0N

item.description: Can’t wait until you can read the brilliant stories the rabbi summoned into life by creating this volume. https://t.co/y2aVThqjln

item.description: @Shmarya @ariella_kay @PeninaDvora @HannahLebovits @ShulimLeifer @chaim_bochner Zazzle is easy to use. But I use it for one-offs — custom mugs for my authors.

item.description: @froomkin @NYMag Spent a morning with my Beloved Conservative Relatives very loud Fox News TV last week. Lots of breathless Hunter coverage.
item.source:markdown: @froomkin @NYMag Spent a morning with my Beloved Conservative Relatives very loud Fox News TV last week. Lots of breathless Hunter coverage.

item.description: @melnickjeffrey1 Never heard of either. But as a big fan of Reed’s later work (including Songs for Drella) listening to them both now.

item.description: @RokhlK Since when is sidewalk sharing a New York virtue?

item.description:
They’re not going to stop until they ban mixed dancing. Which is why they have so much Orthodox Jewish support. https://t.co/eTAL0j3NlO

Of course, given that mixed dancing was a cause of 9/11, who is to say they would be wrong?
item.source:markdown:

item.description: @EladNehorai Actually, earlier tonight I was remembering how addictive I found the Internet in 1992 when there was virtually nothing to read but you could always click to one more gopher site….
item.source:markdown: @EladNehorai Actually, earlier tonight I was remembering how addictive I found the Internet in 1992 when there was virtually nothing to read but you could always click to one more gopher site….
